item.title: Trump Is Gaining in Wisconsin, Where Shooting Casts Cloud Over Start of RNC
item.description: The convention comes on the heels of the assassination attempt on former president.

item.title: JPMorgan, Citigroup to Kick Off Bank Earnings
item.description: Investors will be on the lookout for more signs of weakness in the banking system, as well as the impact of higher-for-longer interest rates.

item.title: Kagame's Expected Election Landslide Disguises Growing Problems for Rwanda
item.description: The country struggles with high poverty rates and growing criticism of its meddling in neighboring Congo.

item.title: Gold Futures Pare Gains After Thursday Rally But Stay Above $2,400 Mark
item.description: Gold futures fell but remained above the $2,400 mark after the softer-than-expected U.S. inflation data on Thursday boosted the case for a dovish pivot towards easing monetary policy at the July Federal Reserve meeting, JPMorgan said.

item.title: Gilt Yields Relatively Steady, Focus on Wednesday's U.K. Inflation Data
item.description: Gilt yields were largely unchanged as investors looked ahead to Wednesday’s U.K. inflation data to gain insight on when the Bank of England could starting cutting interest rates.

item.title: Oil Slips on Stronger U.S. Dollar After Trump Assassination Attempt
item.description: Oil prices edged down as the dollar gained, with investors speculating about the chances of Trump winning the upcoming U.S. election in the wake of the weekend shooting in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Earnings in Spotlight
item.description: Earnings season revs up this week, with analysts expecting S&P 500 companies to report a fourth straight quarter of earnings growth.

item.title: Dollar Edges Higher as Stocks Weaken, Limited Impact From Trump Assassination Attempt
item.description: The safe-haven dollar edged higher, helped by falls in equities after data showed second-quarter Chinese economic growth slowed significantly, while the assassination attempt on Donald Trump had limited impact on markets, ING said.

item.title: Swatch Profits Hit by Weaker Chinese Demand
item.description: Swatch reported a steep drop in first-half sales and profits on weaker demand for luxury goods in China, and cautioned it expected the Chinese market to remain challenging until the end of the year.

item.title: Atos Signs $1.8 Billion Finance Deal With Banks, Bondholders
item.description: The agreement, which was first flagged earlier this month, comes after rescue talks between Atos and a consortium which included shareholder Onepoint fell apart late June.

item.title: Luxury Shares Fall on China's Macroeconomic Challenges
item.description: Shares in European luxury goods companies fell sharply as demand in the all-important Chinese market falters.

item.title: Burberry Replaces CEO as Turnaround Effort Stalls
item.description: British fashion brand Burberry replaced its chief executive officer and said it would halt its dividend amid a downturn in luxury spending—and after a turnaround effort showed signs of fizzling.

item.title: Israel's military was assessing on Sunday whether it killed Hamas commander Mohammed Deifin an airstrikein southern Gaza a day earlier, military officials said.
item.description: Israel’s military was assessing on Sunday whether it killed Hamas commander Mohammed Deif in an airstrike in southern Gaza a day earlier, military officials said.

item.title: In an already turbulent contest, the jarring chaos witnessed in western Pennsylvania, and the fear, anger and images it generated, are certain to alter the contours of a campaign where even small shifts of voter support could prove decisive.
item.description: In an already turbulent contest, the jarring chaos witnessed in western Pennsylvania, and the fear, anger and images it generated, are certain to alter the contours of a campaign where even small shifts of voter support could prove decisive.

item.title: Died: Richard Simmons,76, fitness guru.
item.description: Died: Richard Simmons,76, fitness guru.

item.title: Died: Ruth Westheimer, 96, sex counselor.
item.description: Died: Ruth Westheimer, 96, sex counselor.

item.title: The attempted assassination of Donald Trump at a rally in Pennsylvania represents the biggest security crisis for the Secret Service in decades, prompting a torrent of questions about how the shocking shooting could have happened.
item.description: The attempted assassination of Donald Trump at a rally in Pennsylvania represents the biggest security crisis for the Secret Service in decades, prompting a torrent of questions about how the shocking shooting could have happened.

item.title: The man authorities say was the attacker was a quiet student who took advanced classes, a sometimes-bullied loner who wasn't vocal about his political views, classmates said.
item.description: The man authorities say was the attacker was a quiet student who took advanced classes, a sometimes-bullied loner who wasn’t vocal about his political views, classmates said.

item.title: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk and hedge-fund manager Bill Ackman formally threw their support behind Trump in the wake of Saturday's attempt on the candidate's life, endorsing him for president.
item.description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk and hedge-fund manager Bill Ackman formally threw their support behind Trump in the wake of Saturday’s attempt on the candidate’s life, endorsing him for president.

item.title: New York law firm Mizrahi Kroub filed more than 1,100 web-accessibility lawsuits in the U.S. last year, cases that defense lawyers say are often cut-and-paste pleadings designed to extract quick settlements and not make websites more accessible.
item.description: New York law firm Mizrahi Kroub filed more than 1,100 web-accessibility lawsuits in the U.S. last year, cases that defense lawyers say are often cut-and-paste pleadings designed to extract quick settlements and not make websites more accessible.
